intro: Lepidosperma elatius, commonly known as the tall swamp grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as swamps and marshes, where it thrives in waterlogged soils. Its cylindrical, grass-like stems are often clustered and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family.
